subject: PE Today: Under The Hoodia
body:
CBSNews.com












Should 
      The Virginia Tech Tragedy Be Sparking The Gun Control 
      Debate?As this latest tragedy once again illustrates, the 
      availability of guns is a major issue in this country. The press corps 
      doesn't need a debate in the halls of Congress to recognize that. 
      Certainly, the international press corps has focused on the issue in the 
      wake of the shootings; the British-based Economist, for example, put an 
      American flag in the shape of a gun on its cover and proclaimed that the 
      country's "politicians are still running away from a debate about guns." 
      [+ Read More]

Under 
      The HoodiaAs I noted last February, a 2004 "60 Minutes" 
      story about an African plant has been surprisingly popular on CBSNews.com. 
      The plant in question is hoodia zombieii, "a natural substance that 
      literally takes your appetite away," according to the story. 
      Unsurprisingly, hoodia retailers liked the "60 Minutes" piece. [+ Read More]

The 
      Price Of Free SpeechCheck 
      out Science and Technology Correspondent Daniel Sieberg's interview 
      with BuzzMachine founder Jeff Jarvis. The 
      two talk about whether anything should be done about the more vitriolic 
      rhetoric and comments one can find on the Web. "You can't sanitize the 
      whole world," says Jarvis. "You can't clean up everything. There are going 
      to be miscreants and bad people around. And we all know to step around 
      them."  [+ Read More]
